name: pyrinoline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1432
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base melting point is around 106°C. The presence of two carbonyl groups generally increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C each. Additionally, the piperidine ring formation introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point by about +20°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +5°C. The ethyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased molecular volume, estimated at around -5°C. The presence of two fluorine substituents increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure, estimated at around +10°C each.
